posts.name:
Michael Ocean
Michael Ocean
posts.content:
Enablement is not a vending machine - stop treating it like one!


I recently had a conversation with(Director of Learning Design at JLL, formerly led enablement at Outreach). She shared a powerful perspective on why most enablement initiatives fail: treating enablement like a vending machine instead of a strategic partner.


Key insight: You can't just push a button and get instant results. Like any good sales process, enablement needs discovery:

- What's the real problem you're trying to solve?
- Has this training been done before?
- How will we measure success?
- What's the timeline for meaningful impact?


In the full episode, we covered:

- How JLL runs their "Power Hour" program across 600+ global sellers
- Practical frameworks for building sustainable enablement programs
- Strategies for engaging multi-generational remote teams
- Why random training requests kill enablement effectiveness
- Tips for aligning with sales leaders and getting executive buy-in


Something that really stood out: Brooke's team maintains a 70/30 split between programmatic and ad-hoc enablement - proving you can balance structure with flexibility.


Want to hear the full conversation on building effective everboarding programs?

Check out the link in comments

comments.commentText: Great insights! Treating enablement as a strategic partner is crucial for lasting success. Excited to hear more about those frameworks!

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Treating enablement as a strategic partnership is crucial for success. Looking forward to hearing more about effective frameworks!

THE ONE THING
YOU NEED TO BREAK,
NOW.


‚Äú I explained them, again and again, how my two, super targeted workshops will really help them‚Äù, my client said to me.

‚Äú‚Ä¶the workshops have been created to solve their EXACT need. But they won‚Äôt listen. They want to think. Think WHAT??? WHY????? Don‚Äôt they see their situation will only get worse because of the waiting?‚Äù



Well, they may see it.

The thing is, as countless studies have shown, they behave as they currently do - and as you don‚Äôt want them to:


 Because of WHAT EXISTS *NOW* in their reality.
 Because of what they are CURRENTLY doing.
 Because they are doing it - wrong - for SO LONG.
 Because it‚Äôs part of their ROUTINE, made of dozens of other things that won‚Äôt move that easily.
 Because these other things in their routine, REINFORCE one another, make new action even more difficult.


‚Üí Their NOW is the ENEMY.

To make NEW action HAPPEN, you need tools SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED to make NEW ACTION happen.

Makes sense, right?

Worry no more.

posts.name:
Helen Yu
Helen Yu
posts.content:
What are the top tech trends shaping 2025? 

According to Gartner, here are the Top 10 Technology Trends grouped into three key categories:

 AI Imperatives and Risks
1. Agentic AI: Software making autonomous decisions to automate tasks and boost productivity.
2. AI Governance Platforms: Tools to ensure ethical AI use, improving trust and compliance.
3. Disinformation Security: Cybersecurity solutions to combat disinformation and identity fraud.
 New Frontiers of Computing
4. Post-Quantum Cryptography: Protecting sensitive data from future quantum attacks.
5. Ambient Invisible Intelligence: Low-cost sensors providing real-time visibility in retail and healthcare.
6. Energy-Efficient Computing: Reducing energy use in digital systems and data centers.
7. Hybrid Computing: Combining multiple technologies to solve complex challenges.
 Human-Machine Synergy
8. Spatial Computing: Adding digital content to the physical world for training and shopping.
9. Polyfunctional Robots: Robots performing multiple tasks, especially in healthcare.
10. Neurological Enhancement: Enhancing cognitive abilities through brain-machine interfaces.

These trends represent a shift towards AI-driven autonomy, advanced computing, and human-tech integration, key to digital transformation in 2025 and beyond.

I‚Äôve created a carousel with more details on these trends‚Äîcheck it out for a deeper dive! 

What trend excites you the most? Please share in comments.



Want more insights on
and
?
 Subscribe to the
newsletter hereor our YouTube channel here.

Low-cost sensors can provide real-time visibility, improving safety and efficiency in airports and on aircraft. Additionally, hybrid computing can help solve complex challenges in air traffic management.
